DataElement.preferredName: Hearing Impairment Speech Threshold Integer::500 Hertz Assessment Audiometric Test Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the outcome of the audiometric test assessed at the speech threshold for 500 hertz.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hearing Impairment Speech Threshold 500 Hertz Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders._The exchange of spoken words._The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::500_A SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation (one cycle) per second._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders.

Concepts.definition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: Speech; the exchange of spoken words.:The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.:A number with no fractional part.::500:The SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation per second.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation (one cycle) per second.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2020-12-15 ak Ok to release per WZ.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Moderate: 45-55 dB HL
Moderately Severe: 60-70 dB HL

Normal: 0-20 dB HL
Mild: 25-40 dB HL

Severe: 75-90 dB HL
Profound: greater than 90 dB HL

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Audiometric testing (hearing test) is conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer. The test is usually carried out in a sound room or sound test chamber. Used to test for hearing loss.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss.
